text: Pink Friday is the debut studio album by Trinidadian-American rapper Nicki Minaj. It was released on November 19, 2010, by Young Money, Cash Money and Universal Motown. The album was re-released as a deluxe CD and featured the hit single "Super Bass". ==Track listing== Credits adapted from the liner notes of Pink Friday. ;Sample credits *"Check It Out" samples "Video Killed the Radio Star" performed by The Buggles, and elements and samples of "Think (About It)" written by James Brown, performed by Lyn Collins. *"Blazin" samples "Don't You (Forget About Me)", written by Keith Forsey and Steve Schiff, as performed by Simple Minds. *"Here I Am" samples "Red Sky" by John B and Shaz Sparks. *"Your Love" samples "No More I Love You's" by Annie Lennox. *"Girls Fall Like Dominoes" samples "Dominos" written by The Big Pink, and "Trailar Load a Girls" written by Cleveland Browne, Greville Gordon and Whycliffe Johnson. ==References== Category:2010 albums Category:Debut albums Category:Nicki Minaj albums Category:Cash Money Records albums Category:Hip hop albums Category:Pop albums Category:R&B; albums Category:Young Money Entertainment albums
title: Pink Friday
